title: Window bench
text: In 1902 Charles Limbert advertised a new line of furniture known as "Holland Dutch Arts and Crafts," modeled after similar lines established by Gustave Stickley and the Roycrofters.  He too championed the virtues of handmade craftsmanship, simplicity of line, unadorned surface and fumed oak but, unlike them, he acknowledged his debt to European designers, particularly the Scotsman Charles Rennie Mackintosh, as seen in the square cutouts on the side elements in this window bench.
description: Bench suspended between two footed panels with four cut-out squares on either side
creditline: The Modernism Collection, gift of Norwest Bank Minnesota
